@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<?php

+use Appwrite\Services\Databases;

+$client = (new Client())
+    ->setEndpoint('https://<REGION>.cloud.appwrite.io/v1') // Your API Endpoint

discussion_comments.comment_body:
_⚠️ Potential issue_

**Use server API key authentication instead of session**  
The PHP server SDK requires an API key for authentication; `setSession` will not work in this context. Replace with `setKey('<YOUR_API_KEY>')` to align with other server SDK examples.  


Suggested diff:
```diff
-    ->setSession(''); // The user session to authenticate with
+    ->setKey('<YOUR_API_KEY>'); // Your API key for server-side authentication
```


<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>📝 Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‼️ **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
$client = (new Client())
    ->setEndpoint('https://<REGION>.cloud.appwrite.io/v1') // Your API Endpoint
    ->setProject('<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>') // Your project ID
    ->setKey('<YOUR_API_KEY>'); // Your API key for server-side authentication
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<details>
<summary>🤖 Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In docs/examples/1.6.x/server-php/examples/databases/create-documents.md around
lines 6 to 9, the code incorrectly uses setSession for authentication, which is
not suitable for the PHP server SDK. Replace the setSession('') call with
setKey('<YOUR_API_KEY>') to use API key authentication, ensuring consistency
with other server SDK examples and proper authentication.
```

</details>

_⚠️ Potential issue_

**Use API key authentication for server SDK**  
Server-side Kotlin examples should authenticate with an API key. Replace `.setSession("")` with `.setKey("<YOUR_API_KEY>")` to match other server SDK patterns.  


Suggested diff:
```diff
-    .setSession("") // The user session to authenticate with
+    .setKey("<YOUR_API_KEY>") // Your API key for server-side authentication
```
